tit.e: Town names in Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City
Town names in Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City
Town names in Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City

sen.j: 本項京都市中京区の町名（きょうとしなかぎょうくのちょうめい）では、同区内に存在する公称町名を一覧化するとともに、その成立時期・成立過程等について概説する。
sen.e: This section on "Town Names in Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City", lists official "Town Names" in Nakagyo Ward and summarizes the period and process of their establishment.
This section on "Town names in Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City" lists official town names in Nakagyo Ward and summarizes the period and process of their establishment.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: This section on "Town names in Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City" lists official town names in Nakagyo Ward and summarizes the period and process of their establishment.

sen.j: 京都市街地のほぼ中央に位置する。
sen.e: Nakagyo Ward is located on the center of urban area of Kyoto.
It is located in the center of urban area of Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 一部表現を変更しました。
sen.e: It is located in the center of urban area of Kyoto.

sen.j: 東は左京区と東山区、西・南・北はそれぞれ右京区、下京区、上京区に接し、西北のごく一部が北区 (京都市)に接する。
sen.e: Sakyo Ward and Higashiyama Ward are located in the east, Ukyo Ward, Shimogyo Ward, and Kamigyo Ward are located in the west, south, and north respectively, and a very small part of Kita Ward (Kyoto City) is in the northwest.

Sakyo Ward and Higashiyama Ward are located in the east, Ukyo Ward, Shimogyo Ward, and Kamigyo Ward are located in the west, south, and north respectively, and a very small part of Kita Ward (Kyoto City) is in the northwest.

Sakyo Ward and Higashiyama Ward are located in the east, Ukyo Ward, Shimogyo Ward, and Kamigyo Ward are located in the west, south, and north respectively, and a very small part of Kita Ward (Kyoto City) is in the northwest.

sen.j: 面積7.38平方キロメートル。
sen.e: It covers an area of 7.38 square kilometers.
It covers an area of 7.38 square kilometers.
It covers an area of 7.38 square kilometers.

sen.j: 2009年3月現在の推計人口は約103,600人。
sen.e: Its population projection is about 103,600 as of March 2009.
Its population is estimated to be about 103,600 as of March 2009.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: Its population is estimated to be about 103,600 as of March 2009.

sen.j: 昭和4年（1929年）に上京区・下京区の各一部をもって新設された区である。
sen.e: Nakagyo Ward is a newly established ward by combining parts of Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward respectively.
Nakagyo Ward is a newly established ward by combining parts of Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward respectively in 1929.
Nakagyo Ward is a newly established ward by combining parts of Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward respectively in 1929.

sen.j: 区の東には鴨川が流れ、東山区との境をなす。
sen.e: The Kamo-gawa River runs in the east of Nakagyo Ward and serves as a boundary between Higashiyama Ward.
The Kamo-gawa River runs in the east of Nakagyo Ward and serves as a boundary between Higashiyama Ward.
The Kamo-gawa River runs in the east of Nakagyo Ward and serves as a boundary between Higashiyama Ward.

sen.j: 区の中央部北寄りには二条城が広大な面積を占める。
sen.e: Nijo-jo Castle covers large area of the land in the northern part of the center of Nakagyo Ward.
Nijo-jo Castle covers large area of the land in the northern part of the center of Nakagyo Ward.
Nijo-jo Castle covers large area of the land in the northern part of the center of Nakagyo Ward.

sen.j: 区の南東部、四条河原町周辺は市内随一の繁華街で、花街の面影を残す先斗町（ぽんとちょう）通り、アーケード街の錦市場なども近くにある。
sen.e: The busiest area is around Shijogawara-cho town in the southeast of Nakagyo Ward, and there are Pontocho-dori street which has traces of the Hanamachi (geisha districts), and there is Nishiki market in the neighborhood which is a shopping arcade.

The busiest area is around Shijo Kawaramachi in the southeast of Nakagyo Ward, and there are Pontocho-dori Street which has traces of the Hanamachi (geisha districts) and Nishiki market in the neighborhood which is a shopping arcade.
sen.cmt: Pontocho-dori Street とし、Streetを大文字にしました。
sen.e: The busiest area is around Shijo Kawaramachi in the southeast of Nakagyo Ward, and there are Pontocho-dori Street which has traces of the Hanamachi (geisha districts) and Nishiki market in the neighborhood which is a shopping arcade.

sen.j: 京都市役所も当区内にある。
sen.e: Kyoto City Office is located in Nakagyo Ward.
Kyoto City Hall is located in Nakagyo Ward.
sen.cmt: 市役所→City Hall として統一しました。
sen.e: Kyoto City Hall is located in Nakagyo Ward.

tit.j: 通り名を用いた住所表示
tit.e: Indication of residential address by use of Street Names
Indication of residential address by the use of street names
tit.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
tit.e: Indication of residential address by the use of street names

sen.j: 日本における住所表示は、建物の面している道路名ではなく、建物が所在する町や字（あざ）の名をもって表記されるのが普通であるが、京都の市街地においては例外的に「通り名」を用いた住所表示が行われている。
sen.e: Indication of residential address in Japan is usually expressed not by the street names which the building faces, but are expressed by the name of the town or aza (an administrative designation of small sections into which some of the rural districts of Japan are divided) which the building is located; however, indication of residential address with 'street names' is used exceptionally for the urban area of Kyoto.

Indication of residential address in Japan is usually expressed not by the street names which the building faces, but are expressed by the name of the town or aza (an administrative designation of small sections into which some of the rural districts of Japan are divided) where the building is located; however, indication of residential address with 'street names' is used exceptionally for the urban area of Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: Indication of residential address in Japan is usually expressed not by the street names which the building faces, but are expressed by the name of the town or aza (an administrative designation of small sections into which some of the rural districts of Japan are divided) where the building is located; however, indication of residential address with 'street names' is used exceptionally for the urban area of Kyoto.

sen.j: この方式では、まず、家屋、ビルなどが直接面している通りの名を先に言い、その後に直近で交差する通りの名を付記し、「上る」（あがる）、「下る」（さがる）、「東入」（ひがしいる）、「西入」（にしいる）等と表記する。
sen.e: In this style, the street name which a house or a building directly faces is being mentioned first, and then a name of an intersecting street in the nearest area is added, and 'Agaru' (to the north of), 'Sagaru' (to the north of), 'Higashiiru' (to the east of), 'Nishiiru' (to the west of) and so on are written.

According to this method, the street name which a house or a building directly faces is being mentioned first, and then a name of an intersecting street in the nearest area is added, followed by the expressions such as 'Agaru' (to the north of), 'Sagaru' (to the south of), 'Higashiiru' (to the east of) and 'Nishiiru' (to the west of).
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: According to this method, the street name which a house or a building directly faces is being mentioned first, and then a name of an intersecting street in the nearest area is added, followed by the expressions such as 'Agaru' (to the north of), 'Sagaru' (to the south of), 'Higashiiru' (to the east of) and 'Nishiiru' (to the west of).

sen.j: A通B西入
sen.e: A-dori street, B-nishiiru
A-dori Street, B-nishiiru:
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: A-dori Street, B-nishiiru:

sen.j: - 建物はA通（東西方向の道）に面しており、B通（南北方向の道）との交差点から西に入った地点にある。
sen.e: The building faces A-dori street (a street going east and west) and is located in the spot which is in the west from the intersection with B-dori street (a street going north and south.)
The building faces A-dori Street (a street going east and west) and is located in the spot which is in the west from the intersection with B-dori Street (a street going north and south).
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: The building faces A-dori Street (a street going east and west) and is located in the spot which is in the west from the intersection with B-dori Street (a street going north and south).

sen.j: C通D上る
sen.e: C-dori street, D-agaru
C-dori Street, D-agaru:
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: C-dori Street, D-agaru:

sen.j: - 建物はC通（南北方向の道）に面しており、D通（東西方向の道）との交差点から北に入った地点にある。
sen.e: The building faces C-dori street (a street going north and south) and is located in the spot which is in the north from the intersection with D-dori street (a street going east and west.)
The building faces C-dori Street (a street going north and south) and is located in the spot which is in the north from the intersection with D-dori Street (a street going east and west).
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: The building faces C-dori Street (a street going north and south) and is located in the spot which is in the north from the intersection with D-dori Street (a street going east and west).

sen.j: 住所は上記のような通り名のみで表示する場合もあり、「A通B西入」等の後に町名を併記する場合もある。
sen.e: There are instances where a town name is abbreviated and an address is indicated by a street name alone, and there are also instances where town names are written along after 'A-dori street, B-nishiiru' and so on.
Some addresses are indicated only by the street names as shown above, while others are followed by town names after the indication such as 'A-dori Street, B-nishiiru.'
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: Some addresses are indicated only by the street names as shown above, while others are followed by town names after the indication such as 'A-dori Street, B-nishiiru.'

sen.j: たとえば、京都市役所の所在地は中京区上本能寺前町であるが、これを「京都市中京区寺町通御池上る上本能寺前町488番地」と表示する。
sen.e: For example, the location of Kyoto City Hall is Kami-Honnojimae-cho, Nakagyo Ward, but it is indicated as 'Kyoto City, Nakagyo-ku Teramachi-dori Miike Agaru Kami-Honnojimae-cho 488 Banchi '
For example, the location of Kyoto City Hall is Kami-Honnojimae-cho, Nakagyo Ward, but it is indicated as '488 Kami-Honnojimae-cho, Teramachi-dori Miike-agaru, Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City.'
sen.cmt: 住所表現を変更しました。
sen.e: For example, the location of Kyoto City Hall is Kami-Honnojimae-cho, Nakagyo Ward, but it is indicated as '488 Kami-Honnojimae-cho, Teramachi-dori Miike-agaru, Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City.'

tit.cmt: 小タイトルのため、一部を小文字に変更しました。
小タイトルのため、一部を小文字に変更しました。

sen.j: 京都市内の町名には「大原来迎院町」のように旧村名、旧大字名に由来する地名（上記例の場合は「大原」）を冠称するものと、「亀屋町」「菊屋町」のような単独町名とがある。
sen.e: The Town Names of Kyoto City are categorized into those using their former village names or former Oaza (large section of village) such as 'Ohara Raikoin-Cho' (in this case, 'Ohara' is former name) and those using an independent name of a town such as 'Kameya-Cho' and 'Kikuya-Cho.'

The town names of Kyoto City are categorized into those using their former village names or former Oaza (large section of village) such as 'Ohara Raikoin-cho' (in this case, 'Ohara' is the former name) and those using an independent name of a town such as 'Kameya-cho' and 'Kikuya-cho.'
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: The town names of Kyoto City are categorized into those using their former village names or former Oaza (large section of village) such as 'Ohara Raikoin-cho' (in this case, 'Ohara' is the former name) and those using an independent name of a town such as 'Kameya-cho' and 'Kikuya-cho.'

sen.j: 中京区においては、区のほぼ東半分の地域の町名は単独町名であり、西部は市町村合併以前の地名を継承する「聚楽廻」「西ノ京」「壬生」を冠称する町名となる。
sen.e: In Nakagyo Ward, the town names of almost half of the east of Nakagyo Ward are independent names of a town, in the western part of Nakagyo Ward, the town names includes 'Jurakumawari', 'Nishinokyo', and 'Mibu' which succeeds place names prior to municipal merger.

In Nakagyo Ward, town names in most of the eastern half of Nakagyo Ward are independent town names, while those in the western part of Nakagyo Ward are prefixed by the place names from before the municipal merger such as 'Jurakumawari,' 'Nishinokyo' and 'Mibu.'
sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を変更しました。
sen.e: In Nakagyo Ward, town names in most of the eastern half of Nakagyo Ward are independent town names, while those in the western part of Nakagyo Ward are prefixed by the place names from before the municipal merger such as 'Jurakumawari,' 'Nishinokyo' and 'Mibu.'

sen.j: 区内の公称町名の数は、『角川日本地名大辞典 26 京都府』下巻によれば498町（1980年現在）である。
sen.e: According to the second volume of "Kadokawa Nihon Chimei Daijiten No. 26 Kyoto-Fu" (Kadokawa dictionary of place-names of Japan, No. 26 Kyoto Prefecture), there were officially 498 declared towns in 1980.

According to the second volume of "Kadokawa Nihon Chimei Daijiten No. 26 Kyoto-Fu" (Kadokawa dictionary of place-names of Japan, No. 26 Kyoto Prefecture), there were officially 498 declared towns as of 1980.

According to the second volume of "Kadokawa Nihon Chimei Daijiten No. 26 Kyoto-Fu" (Kadokawa dictionary of place-names of Japan, No. 26 Kyoto Prefecture), there were officially 498 declared towns as of 1980.

sen.j: この町数は2009年現在も変化していない。
sen.e: The number of towns remain unchanged as of 2009.
The number of towns remains unchanged as of 2009.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: The number of towns remains unchanged as of 2009.

sen.j: 京都市においては「住居表示に関する法律」に基づく住居表示は実施されておらず、市内の公称町名については、「京都市区の所管区域条例」（昭和24年4月1日京都市条例第7号）が根拠となっている。
sen.e: Indication of residential address based on 'Act on Indication of Residential Address' is not implemented in Kyoto City, and the official town names within the city are based on 'Municipal ordinance of jurisdiction districts of Kyoto City and Wards' (Act No.7 of Kyoto City Ordinance, April 1, 1949).

Indication of residential address based on 'Act on Indication of Residential Address' is not implemented in Kyoto City, and the official town names within the city are based on 'Municipal Ordinance of Jurisdiction Districts of Kyoto City' (Act No. 7 of Kyoto Municipal Ordinance, April 1, 1949).
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: Indication of residential address based on 'Act on Indication of Residential Address' is not implemented in Kyoto City, and the official town names within the city are based on 'Municipal Ordinance of Jurisdiction Districts of Kyoto City' (Act No. 7 of Kyoto Municipal Ordinance, April 1, 1949).

sen.j: 「所管区域条例」に列挙される中京区の町名は『角川日本地名大辞典』のそれとおおむね一致するが、細部には差異がある（「備考」の項を参照）。
sen.e: The number of towns enumerated in 'Municipal ordinance of jurisdiction districts' equals by and large to that of "Kadokawa Nihon Chimei Daijiten", but there are differences in the particulars (refer to the section on 'reference').
The town names in Nakagyo Ward listed in 'Municipal Ordinance of Jurisdiction Districts' basically match those in "Kadokawa Nihon Chimei Daijiten," although differing in detail. (See 'Remarks.')
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: The town names in Nakagyo Ward listed in 'Municipal Ordinance of Jurisdiction Districts' basically match those in "Kadokawa Nihon Chimei Daijiten," although differing in detail. (See 'Remarks.')

sen.j: 近世には、二条通り以北を上京、以南を下京と称し、上京には「上京十二組」「禁裏六丁組」、下京には「下京八組」という町組（ちょうぐみ）が組織されていた。
sen.e: In the early modern Kyoto, areas north of Nijo-dori Street was referred to as Kamigyo, and areas south of Nijo-dori Street was referred to as Shimogyo; and chogumi (town society) called 'Kamigyo town society No. 12' and 'Kinri Rokucho town society' were formed in Kamigyo and 'Shimogyo Town Society No. 8' was formed in Shimogyo.
sen.cmt: 「上京十二組」「下京八組」は定訳不明です。『京都府の歴史』（山川出版社）内の説明などを参考に訳出致しました。
sen.e: In the early modern Kyoto, the area north of Nijo-dori Street was referred to as Kamigyo, and the area south of Nijo-dori Street was referred to as Shimogyo; and chogumi (town society) called 'Twelve town societies of Kamigyo' and 'Kinri Rokucho town society' were formed in Kamigyo, and 'Eight town societies of Shimogyo' were formed in Shimogyo.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: In the early modern Kyoto, the area north of Nijo-dori Street was referred to as Kamigyo, and the area south of Nijo-dori Street was referred to as Shimogyo; and chogumi (town society) called 'Twelve town societies of Kamigyo' and 'Kinri Rokucho town society' were formed in Kamigyo, and 'Eight town societies of Shimogyo' were formed in Shimogyo.

sen.j: 町組は近隣の町の連合体、自治組織であり、その起源は判然としないが、室町時代には存在が確認される。
sen.e: Chogumi was an union of neighboring towns and a self-governing organization, and although its origin is unclear, its existence during the Muromachi Period is ascertained.
Chogumi was an union of neighboring towns and a self-governing organization, and although its origin is unclear, its existence can be confirmed already in the Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: Chogumi was an union of neighboring towns and a self-governing organization, and although its origin is unclear, its existence can be confirmed already in the Muromachi period.

sen.j: 明治元年（1868年）、京都府の成立とともに、上京・下京の町組は上京1 - 45番組、下京1 - 41番組に編成されるが、翌明治2年（1869年）には町組改正で上京1 - 33番組、下京1 - 32番組に再編成された。
sen.e: With the establishment of Kyoto Prefecture in 1868, the chogumi of Kamigyo and Shimogyo were integrated into Kamigyo kumi Nos. 1-45 and Shimogyo kumi Nos.1-41, but a year later in 1869, they were reorganized into Kamigyo kumi Nos. 1-33 and Shimogyo kumi Nos. 1-32 by the chogumi reorganization.

With the establishment of Kyoto Prefecture in 1868, the chogumi of Kamigyo and Shimogyo were organized into Kamigyo bangumi (town unit) Nos. 1-45 and Shimogyo bangumi Nos.1-41, but a year later in 1869, they were reorganized into Kamigyo bangumi Nos. 1-33 and Shimogyo bangumi Nos. 1-32 by the chogumi reorganization.

With the establishment of Kyoto Prefecture in 1868, the chogumi of Kamigyo and Shimogyo were organized into Kamigyo bangumi (town unit) Nos. 1-45 and Shimogyo bangumi Nos.1-41, but a year later in 1869, they were reorganized into Kamigyo bangumi Nos. 1-33 and Shimogyo bangumi Nos. 1-32 by the chogumi reorganization.

sen.j: 明治5年（1872年）には「番組」が「区」に改められ、上京1 - 33区、下京1 - 32区となった。
sen.e: In 1872, 'bangumi' was changed to 'ku', resulting in Kamigyo ku Nos. 1-33 and Shimogyo ku Nos. 1-32.
In 1872, 'bangumi' was changed to 'ward,' resulting in Kamigyo ward Nos. 1-33 and Shimogyo ward Nos. 1-32.
sen.cmt: ku→ward として他の記事と統一しました。
sen.e: In 1872, 'bangumi' was changed to 'ward,' resulting in Kamigyo ward Nos. 1-33 and Shimogyo ward Nos. 1-32.

sen.j: 上京が33、下京が32に区分される点は変わらないが、旧下京24番組が下京7区と15区に二分され、旧下京22番組と32番組が統合されて下京16区になっている。
sen.e: There are no changes in terms of dividing Kamigyo into 33 divisions and Shimogyo into 32 divisions, but the former Shimogyo kumi No. 24 was divided into Shimogyo 7 ku and 15 ku, and the former kumi No. 22 and 32 were combined to form Shimogyo ku No. 16.

While there were no changes in terms of dividing Kamigyo and Shimogyo into 33 and 32, respectively, the former Shimogyo bangumi No. 24 was divided into Shimogyo wards No. 7 and No. 15, and the former bangumi No. 22 and 32 were combined to form Shimogyo ward No. 16.
sen.cmt: ku→ward として他の記事と統一しました。kumi →bangumi としました。
sen.e: While there were no changes in terms of dividing Kamigyo and Shimogyo into 33 and 32, respectively, the former Shimogyo bangumi No. 24 was divided into Shimogyo wards No. 7 and No. 15, and the former bangumi No. 22 and 32 were combined to form Shimogyo ward No. 16.

sen.j: 明治12（1879年）年、京都府に上京区・下京区が設置されると、前述の「区」は、番号はそのままで「組」と改称、上京1 - 33組、下京1 - 32組となる。
sen.e: When Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward were established inside Kyoto Prefecture in 1879, "ku" was renamed to 'kumi' with the numbers unchanged, resulting in Kamigyo kumi Nos. 1-33 and Shimogyo kumi Nos. 1-32.

When Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward were established inside Kyoto Prefecture in 1879, 'ward' was renamed to 'kumi' with the numbers unchanged, resulting in Kamigyo kumi Nos. 1-33 and Shimogyo kumi Nos. 1-32.

When Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward were established inside Kyoto Prefecture in 1879, 'ward' was renamed to 'kumi' with the numbers unchanged, resulting in Kamigyo kumi Nos. 1-33 and Shimogyo kumi Nos. 1-32.

sen.j: 明治22年（1889年）、京都市制とともに、上京区・下京区は京都市の区となる。
sen.e: With the enforcement of the municipal system of Kyoto City in 1889, Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward became a ward of Kyoto City.
With the enforcement of Municipal Government Act of Kyoto City in 1889, Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward became the wards of Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: With the enforcement of Municipal Government Act of Kyoto City in 1889, Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward became the wards of Kyoto City.

sen.j: なお、近世と違い、二条通りではなく三条通りが上京・下京の境となっている。
sen.e: Further, unlike the early modern times in Kyoto, instead of Nijo-dori Street, Sanjo-dori Street became the border between Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward.
Unlike the early-modern times in Kyoto, instead of Nijo-dori Street, Sanjo-dori Street became the border between Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: Unlike the early-modern times in Kyoto, instead of Nijo-dori Street, Sanjo-dori Street became the border between Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward.

sen.j: この間、明治21年（1888年）には同年上京区・下京区に編入された愛宕郡の旧村の区域に上京34組及び下京33組が設定された。
sen.e: In the mean time, 34 gumi of Kamigyo and 33 gumi of Shimogyo were created in the area of the old village which was in Otagi-gun County that was integrated into Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward in the same year 1888.

During this period, in 1888, Kamigyo kumi No. 34 and Shimogyo kumi No. 33 were established in the former village area of Otagi County that had been incorporated into Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward in the same year.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: During this period, in 1888, Kamigyo kumi No. 34 and Shimogyo kumi No. 33 were established in the former village area of Otagi County that had been incorporated into Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward in the same year.

sen.j: 明治25年（1892年）には「組」を「学区」に改組。
sen.e: By 1892, 'kumi' was reorganized into 'school district.'
In 1892, 'kumi' was reorganized into 'school district.'
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: In 1892, 'kumi' was reorganized into 'school district.'

sen.j: 旧上京1 - 33組、下京1 - 32組は上京第1 - 28学区、下京1 - 32学区に編成された。
sen.e: The former Kamigyo kumi Nos. 1 to 33 and Shimogyo kumi Nos. 1 to 32 were organized into Kamigyo school districts No. 1 to 28 and Shimogyo school districts No. 1 to 32.
The former Kamigyo kumi Nos. 1 to 33 and Shimogyo kumi Nos. 1 to 32 were organized into Kamigyo school districts Nos. 1 to 28 and Shimogyo school districts No. 1 to 32 respectively.
The former Kamigyo kumi Nos. 1 to 33 and Shimogyo kumi Nos. 1 to 32 were organized into Kamigyo school districts Nos. 1 to 28 and Shimogyo school districts No. 1 to 32 respectively.

sen.j: このうち、上京第18 - 26学区と下京第1 - 6学区が現在の中京区の東半部に相当する。
sen.e: Of these, Kamigyo school districts No. 18 to 26 and Shimogyo school districts No. 1 to 6 are equivalent to the eastern half of the present-day Nakagyo Ward.
Of these, Kamigyo school districts Nos. 18 to 26 and Shimogyo school districts Nos. 1 to 6 are equivalent to the eastern half of the present-day Nakagyo Ward.
Of these, Kamigyo school districts Nos. 18 to 26 and Shimogyo school districts Nos. 1 to 6 are equivalent to the eastern half of the present-day Nakagyo Ward.

sen.j: 中京区は昭和4年（1929年）に上京区・下京区の各一部をもって新設された。
sen.e: Nakagyo Ward was newly created by combining a part of Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo ward in 1929.
Nakagyo Ward was newly created by combining a part of Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward in 1929.
Nakagyo Ward was newly created by combining a part of Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward in 1929.

sen.j: 同年、学区名に小学校名を付して「梅屋学区」「竹間学区」のように称するようになる。
sen.e: In the same year, the names of elementary schools were added to be referred to as 'Umeya school district' and 'Chikkan school district.'
In the same year, the names of elementary schools were added to the names of the school districts to be referred to as 'Umeya school district' and 'Chikkan school district.'
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: In the same year, the names of elementary schools were added to the names of the school districts to be referred to as 'Umeya school district' and 'Chikkan school district.'

sen.j: 昭和16年（1941年）の国民学校令の発布とともに学区制は廃止された。
sen.e: With the proclamation of Kokumin gakko rei (Act of elementary schools) in 1941, school district system was abolished.
With the proclamation of Kokumin gakko rei (Act of elementary schools) in 1941, school district system was abolished.
With the proclamation of Kokumin gakko rei (Act of elementary schools) in 1941, school district system was abolished.

sen.j: したがって、これらの学区は現在では正式の行政区域ではないが、「元学区」という形で、地域の通称としては現在も使われている。
sen.e: Therefore, although these school districts are not an official administrative districts, they are used in the present-day as common names of an area in the form of 'old school districts of Kyoto.'
Therefore, these school districts are not official administrative district today, but they are still used as aliases of areas in the form of 'former school districts.'
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: Therefore, these school districts are not official administrative district today, but they are still used as aliases of areas in the form of 'former school districts.'

sen.j: なお、学校の統廃合等により、元学区と現在の通学区とは一致していない。
sen.e: With the proclamation of Kokumin gakko rei (Act of elementary schools) in 1941, school district system was abolished.
Meanwhile, due to the integration and abolition of schools, there is no consistency between the old school districts and the present-day attendance units.
Meanwhile, due to the integration and abolition of schools, there is no consistency between the old school districts and the present-day attendance units.

sen.j: 下の表は、上述の変遷をまとめたものである。

sen.e: The changes of former school districts in Nakagyo Ward

sen.j: 区内の東半部の町名は、おおむね近世以来の町界・町名を現代に引き継いでいる。
sen.e: The town names in the eastern half of Nakagyo Ward are mostly passed on to the present-day from the borders of towns and town names of the early-modern times.
The town names in the eastern half of Nakagyo Ward have succeeded most of the borders and names of the towns since the early-modern times.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: The town names in the eastern half of Nakagyo Ward have succeeded most of the borders and names of the towns since the early-modern times.

sen.j: ただし、明治時代の初期に数か町が合併して新たに命名された町、寺院境内地など、従来町名のなかった土地に新たに起立した町名なども一部に存在する。
sen.e: However, there are a great number of town names including towns which had been newly named by the merging of few towns in the early Meiji Period or those which were made for areas where town names had not existed such as the estate of Kitano Tenjin Shrine.

However, there are some towns that were established by merger of several towns in the early Meiji period and given a new name, or towns that were newly established in areas that didn't have traditional town names such as precincts of shrines.
sen.cmt: 北野天神 不要なため削除しました。
sen.e: However, there are some towns that were established by merger of several towns in the early Meiji period and given a new name, or towns that were newly established in areas that didn't have traditional town names such as precincts of shrines.

sen.j: 二条城の敷地を町域とする「二条城町」は昭和14年に成立したものだが、他の単独町名は遅くとも明治時代初期には成立している。
sen.e: Nijo-jo machi' which makes the premise of Nijo-jo Castle as its boundary was established in 1939, but other individual town names were established in the early Meiji Period at the latest.
The town 'Nijojo-machi' which makes the premise of Nijo-jo Castle as its boundary was established in 1939, but other individual town names were established in the early Meiji Period at the latest.

tit.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。

sen.j: 中京区の西部は、明治22年（1889年）の市制町村制施行時には葛野郡朱雀野村（かどのぐんすじゃくのむら）であった。
sen.e: The western part of Nakagyo Ward was Sujaku no mura, Kadono-gun prior to the enforcement of Municipal Government Act in 1889.
The western part of Nakagyo Ward was Sujaku village, Kadono County prior to the enforcement of Municipal Government Act in 1889.
sen.cmt: 歴史的な変遷が関連しているため、葛野郡→Kadono County としました。
sen.e: The western part of Nakagyo Ward was Sujaku village, Kadono County prior to the enforcement of Municipal Government Act in 1889.

sen.j: 朱雀野村は大正7年（1918年）、当時の上京区と下京区に分割して編入された。
sen.e: Sujaku Village was integrated into Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward at the time in 1918.
Sujaku village was split and integrated into the then Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward in 1918.
sen.cmt: 一部表現を変更しました。
sen.e: Sujaku village was split and integrated into the then Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward in 1918.

sen.j: 同村には聚楽廻（じゅらくまわり）、西ノ京、壬生（みぶ）の3つの大字があったが、これらは計74の町に編成された。
sen.e: There were Jurakumawari, Nishinokyo, and Mibu which were three oaza (an administrative unit), but they were organized into a total of 74 towns.
There had been three Oaza (large section of village) in the village; Jurakumawari, Nishinokyo, and Mibu, but they were organized into a total of 74 towns.
sen.cmt: 一部表現を変更しました。
sen.e: There had been three Oaza (large section of village) in the village; Jurakumawari, Nishinokyo, and Mibu, but they were organized into a total of 74 towns.

sen.j: 「聚楽廻」を冠称する町は、もとの朱雀野村聚楽廻で、大正7年上京区に編入され、5町に編成された。
sen.e: Towns that use the name 'Jurakumawari' is a former Jurakumawari, Sujaku no mura, which was integrated into Kamigyo Ward in 1918 and organized into 5 towns.
Towns whose names are prefixed by 'Jurakumawari' are located in the former Jurakumawari, Sujaku village, which was integrated into Kamigyo Ward in 1918 to be organized into five towns.
sen.cmt: 一部表現を変更しました。
sen.e: Towns whose names are prefixed by 'Jurakumawari' are located in the former Jurakumawari, Sujaku village, which was integrated into Kamigyo Ward in 1918 to be organized into five towns.

sen.j: 昭和4年（1929年）中京区成立とともに同区の町名となった。
sen.e: With the establishment of Nakagyo Ward in 1929, Jurakumawari became a town name in the Nakagyo Ward.
With the establishment of Nakagyo Ward in 1929, Jurakumawari became a town name in the Nakagyo Ward.

sen.j: 「西ノ京」を冠称する町は、もとの朱雀野村西ノ京で、大正7年上京区に編入され、52町に編成された。
sen.e: Towns that uses 'Nishinokyo' in their names belonged to the former Nishinokyo, Sujaku no mura, which was integrated into Kamigyo Ward in 1918 and organized to 52 towns.

sen.j: 昭和25年（1950年）西鹿垣町、上平町、北・西円町、南大炊御門町が成立。

sen.j: 「壬生」を冠称する町は、大部分がもとの朱雀野村壬生、一部が葛野郡西院村西院で、ともに大正7年（1918年）下京区に編入され、22町に編成された。
sen.e: Most of the towns that use 'Mibu' in their names belonged to the former Mibu, Suzakuno-mura and a part of Sai, Sai-mura, Kuzuno-gun, and both were integrated into Shimogyo Ward in 1918, and reorganized into 22 towns.

Of the towns whose names are prefixed by 'Mibu,' most of them are located in the former Mibu, Suzaku village while a part of them in Sai, Sai village, Kadono County, and both were integrated into Shimogyo Ward in 1918 to be reorganized into 22 towns.

sen.e: Of the twenty two towns which were mentioned above, the five towns of Fuchida-cho, Doinouchi-cho, Hinoki-cho, Higashitakada-cho were a part of Sai, Sai-mura, and the name 'Sai' was used in the beginning, but from 1931, 'Mibu' was used.

sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。

sen.j: たとえば、「下丸屋町」という町は、京都市役所や本能寺の近くの「河原町通御池下る」にあるほか、そこから数百メートル西北方の「小川通夷川上る」にも同じ名の町がある。
sen.e: For example, a town named 'Shimomaruya-cho' exist in 'Oike-dori Sagaru, Kawaramachi-dori Street' near Kyoto City Hall and Honnoji-temple, and other than that, there is a same town with the same name in 'Ebisugawa-agaru, Ogawa-dori Street' which is in few hundred meters west north from ''.

For example, while there is a town named 'Shimomaruya-cho' in 'Kawaramachi-dori Oike-sagaru' near Kyoto City Hall and Honno-ji Temple, another exists in 'Ogawa-dori Ebisugawa-agaru' which is few hundred meters to the northwest from there.
sen.cmt: 一部表現を変更しました。
sen.e: For example, while there is a town named 'Shimomaruya-cho' in 'Kawaramachi-dori Oike-sagaru' near Kyoto City Hall and Honno-ji Temple, another exists in 'Ogawa-dori Ebisugawa-agaru' which is few hundred meters to the northwest from there.

sen.j: これらはいわゆる飛地ではなく、起源を異にする別個の町である。

sen.e: Kuwabara-cho, Ishiya-cho (Fuyu school district):

sen.j: - 町地の大部分が京都御苑敷地内となり、現状は丸太町通り沿いのごく狭小な土地を残すのみ。
sen.e: Large part of the towns have become the premise of Kyoto Gyoen, and at present, only a small part of land along the Marutamachi-dori street remains
Large part of the towns have become the premise of Kyoto Gyoen National Garden, and at present, only a small part of land along the Marutamachi-dori Street remains
sen.cmt: Street 大文字にしました。
sen.e: Large part of the towns have become the premise of Kyoto Gyoen National Garden, and at present, only a small part of land along the Marutamachi-dori Street remains

sen.j: 瓦町、瓦之町
sen.e: Kawara-cho, Kawarano-cho
Kawara-cho, Kawarano-cho:
sen.cmt: コロンを追加しました。
sen.e: Kawara-cho, Kawarano-cho:

sen.j: - ともに初音学区内にある。
sen.e: - Both towns are in the Hatsune school district.
Both towns are in the Hatsune school district.
sen.cmt: 文頭のハイフンを削除しました。
sen.e: Both towns are in the Hatsune school district.

tit.j: 明治以降廃止された旧町名
tit.e: Old town names that were abolished after the Meiji Period
Old town names abolished after the Meiji period
tit.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
tit.e: Old town names abolished after the Meiji period

sen.j: 西ノ京日扇町
sen.e: Nishinokyo Hiogi-cho
Nishinokyo Hiogi-cho:
sen.cmt: コロンを追加しました。
sen.e: Nishinokyo Hiogi-cho:

sen.j: - この町名は、『角川日本地名大辞典 26 京都府』では現行行政地名とされているが、京都市の各区に属する公称町名を列挙した「京都市区の所管区域条例」（昭和24年4月1日京都市条例第7号）には収録されていない。
sen.e: This town name is regarded as an administrative district of the present according to "Kadokawa Nihon Chimei Daijiten", but it is not included in 'Municipal ordinance of jurisdiction districts of Kyoto City' (Act No.7 of Kyoto Municipal Ordinance, April 1, 1949) which enumerates official town names that belong to the each ward in Kyoto City.

This town name is regarded as an administrative district of the present according to "Kadokawa Nihon Chimei Daijiten," but it is not included in 'Municipal Ordinance of Jurisdiction Districts of Kyoto City' (Act No.7 of Kyoto Municipal Ordinance, April 1, 1949) which enumerates official town names that belong to the each ward in Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: 「京都市区の所管区域条例」→Municipal Ordinance of Jurisdiction Districts of Kyoto City 大文字で表記しました。
sen.e: This town name is regarded as an administrative district of the present according to "Kadokawa Nihon Chimei Daijiten," but it is not included in 'Municipal Ordinance of Jurisdiction Districts of Kyoto City' (Act No.7 of Kyoto Municipal Ordinance, April 1, 1949) which enumerates official town names that belong to the each ward in Kyoto City.

sen.j: ただし、公職選挙法に基づく投票区を定めた告示（昭和42年11月2日中京区選管告示第5号）では、第19投票区に属する町名の1つとして「西ノ京日扇町」がみえる。
sen.e: However, in an announcement that determined the election district based on Public Offices Election Act (No. 5 of Nakagyo Ward election management announcement, November 2, 1967), 'Nishinokyo Hiogi-cho' was shown as one of the town names that belong to the 19th election district.

However, in an announcement that determined the election district based on Public Offices Election Act (Announcement No. 5 by the Nakagyo Ward Electoral Management Committee, November 2, 1967), 'Nishinokyo Hiogi-cho' was shown as one of the town names that belong to the 19th election district.
sen.cmt: 「昭和42年11月2日中京区選管告示第5号」→表現を他の記事と統一しました。
sen.e: However, in an announcement that determined the election district based on Public Offices Election Act (Announcement No. 5 by the Nakagyo Ward Electoral Management Committee, November 2, 1967), 'Nishinokyo Hiogi-cho' was shown as one of the town names that belong to the 19th election district.

sen.j: 当該町の区域は工場敷地の一部となっている。
sen.e: Areas of Nishinokyo Hiogi-cho is part of a factory site.
Areas of Nishinokyo Hiogi-cho is part of a factory site.
Areas of Nishinokyo Hiogi-cho is part of a factory site.

sen.j: 東大文字町、西大文字町（生祥学区）
sen.e: Higashidaimonji-cho and Nishidaimonji-cho (Seisho school district)
Higashi Daimonji-cho and Nishi Daimonji-cho (Seisho school district):
sen.cmt: Higashi Daimonji-cho, Nishi Daimonji-cho として、スペースを追加しました。コロンを追加しました。
sen.e: Higashi Daimonji-cho and Nishi Daimonji-cho (Seisho school district):

sen.j: - 上記「所管区域条例」ではともに「大文字町」と表記されている。
sen.e: Both towns are written as '大文字町' in the above-mentioned 'Municipal ordinance of Jurisdiction districts'.
Both towns are written as 'Daimonji-cho' in the above-mentioned 'Municipal Ordinance of Jurisdiction Districts'.
sen.cmt: 大文字町→Daimonji-cho と変更しました。
sen.e: Both towns are written as 'Daimonji-cho' in the above-mentioned 'Municipal Ordinance of Jurisdiction Districts'.
